newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine peso ends almost steady on intervention.
newsitem.headline: Philippine peso ends almost steady on intervention.

text.p: The Philippine peso closed almost steady at 26.323 on Thursday from 26.322 as the Central Bank intervened heavily in the market, traders said.
Dollars, triggered by the recent launch of Europeso issuances, continued to flow into the system, traders said.
"The Europeso generated a lot of interest back to the Philippines," a foreign bank dealer said.
As expected, the Central Bank bought dollars again from banks in the amount of $72 million to $74 million at 26.322 and 26.323, traders estimated.
Market volume, however, was smaller at $169 million from $274.30 million.
On Friday, dealers believe the peso may be pulled down by the interest arbitage play for the weekend. But this may be offset by more inflows, they said.
